Hi Ken,

2009/6/26 Ken Lloyd <kalloyd@...>:



>

s and Species=A0from their genomes.=A0 This is somewhat

ting the location vertices (I'm using n-dim hyperpoints)

n graphs.=A0 Nodes can, and are,=A0inherited to be neural
> network neurons=
, and combined with genetic information, to become

perimenting with co-evolutions of higher level

representations).

It did occur to me that the connection IDs are redundant=
 information
in representing a graph. Say we are using 32bit integers for t=
he node
IDs, then a connection can be represented by the two nodes at it's
=
endpoints to form a single 64bit integer to act as the connection ID.
Anywa=
y, this and my separating of the connection and node ID spaces
does mean yo=
u lose the order in which connections were added, eitehr
completely in the =
endpoint ID case or relatve to the node IDs in the
case of separate ID spac=
es/counters.

I hadn't really considered order of element addition to be im=
portant,
which from the point of view of an EA trying to find a solution it=

isn't. But it may be useful information for research into the NEAT
method =
itself.

 on the problem

 various contexts

figuration

ructures on the

resting. Do you think this result in some simplified hard and fast

u/we can use to get near optimal experimental setups with
